statements: SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_id, job_title FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Marketing' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, department FROM Employee WHERE job_title = 'Manager' ORDER BY department DESC, first_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Sales' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, job_title FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Marketing' ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM Employee WHERE job_title = 'Manager' AND department = 'HR' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE employee_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200 ORDER BY employee_id ASC;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM Employee WHERE job_title = 'Engineer' ORDER BY last_name ASC, first_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY first_name DESC;
SELECT job_title, department FROM employees WHERE department='IT';
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM employees WHERE job_title='Manager' AND department='HR';
SELECT employee_id, phone_number FROM employees WHERE department='Finance';
SELECT department_name, department_head_id FROM departments;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name, job_title FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS department_size FROM departments GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.employee_id = d.department_head_id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE phone_number LIKE '%555%' ORDER BY last_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE department='HR';
SELECT employee_name, hire_date FROM Employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT department_name, location FROM Departments WHERE department_id=2;
SELECT * FROM Titles WHERE title_name='Manager';
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, department FROM Employees ORDER BY department ASC, employee_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE department ='HR';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employees WHERE hire_date > '2020-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE employee_id = 1001;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) as TotalEmployees FROM Employees GROUP BY department;
SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name, t.title_name FROM Employees e JOIN Departments d ON e.department = d.department_name JOIN Titles t ON e.employee_id = t.title_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT full_name, position FROM employees WHERE department='IT';
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) as num_employees FROM employees GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM departments ORDER BY department_name ASC;
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date FROM projects WHERE status='Active';
SELECT full_name, position, department FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM departments ORDER BY location ASC;
SELECT full_name, department_name, hire_date FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department = departments.department_name;
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date, managers.full_name AS manager_name FROM projects JOIN managers ON projects.manager_id = managers.manager_id WHERE projects.status = 'In Progress';
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date, full_name AS manager_name FROM projects JOIN managers ON projects.manager_id = managers.manager_id ORDER BY start_date DESC, end_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department, position FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) as total_employees FROM employees GROUP BY department;
SELECT name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM departments WHERE manager_id IS NULL AND location = 'New York';
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC, salary ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT name, department, salary FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' AND salary > 50000;

SELECT e.name, d.name AS department, p.title AS position, s.amount AS current_salary FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.name JOIN positions p ON e.position = p.title JOIN salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE s.end_date IS NULL;
SELECT department, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employees GROUP BY department ORDER BY avg_salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees LEFT JOIN locations ON employees.department = locations.name;
